Convert Degree Minute Seconds (DMS) format to Decimal Degrees (DD)

Source: R/utils-conversions.R
dms2dd.Rd

Convert Degree Minute Seconds (DMS) format to Decimal Degrees (DD)

Usage

dms2dd(value)

Arguments

value

a string representation of an angle (i.e. longitude) in Degree Minute Second (DMS)), i.e. "51° 43' 34.00\" N"

         \strong{Note} the escaping of double quote.

Value

a decimal degrees value

See also

Other coordinates: ddm2dd(), parse_lat_icao(), parse_lon_icao()

Examples

ddm2dd("51° 43' 34.00\u0022 N")
#> [1] NA
